page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content: The area is densely populated and the nature of houses is greatly varied.A high proportion of the dwelling places are council owned and are of the following types: detatched, semi, terraced, bungalows, town houses and a blocks of flats.Many houses along Bulkington Road area are of an older variety and some date back to the turn of the century.Behind these and in the centre of the area are newer post second world war.The small semi detatched bungalows and the flats have been recently built and most are occupied by old people.One small section on York Ave. comprises purpose built bungalows for elderly people and a warden and deputy warden look after their welfare.The atmosphere on the estate is quiet and peaceful and near the homes for elderly people are flower beds,grass and benches.
